db:info.db:title: Qt Virtual Keyboard
db:info.db:edition: Qt Virtual Keyboard | Commercial or GPLv3

db:article.db:para: The Qt Virtual Keyboard project provides an input framework and reference keyboard frontend for Qt 6 on Linux Desktop/X11, Windows Desktop, and Boot2Qt targets.
The input framework makes it easy to write custom input methods or to integrate 3rd party input engines. The input methods can be implemented in C++ or QML.

db:section.db:title: Using the Module
db:section.db:para: Using a Qt module's C++ API requires linking against the module library, either directly or through other dependencies. Several build tools have dedicated support for this, including CMake and qmake.

db:section.db:title: Building with CMake
db:section.db:para: Use the find_package() command to locate the needed module component in the Qt6 package:
db:section.db:programlisting: find_package(Qt6 REQUIRED COMPONENTS VirtualKeyboard) target_link_libraries(mytarget PRIVATE Qt6::VirtualKeyboard)
db:section.db:para: For more details, see the Build with CMake overview.

db:section.db:title: Building with qmake
db:section.db:para: To configure the module for building with qmake, add the module as a value of the QT variable in the project's .pro file:
